instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the LED light in the screen of the device that allows you to see what is on the screen. When this is low or missing, the screen will be dim..
definitions.BKLT_SD: What is BKLT_SD? BKLT_SD is a pin of the LED driver that goes to the voltage divider that feeds the gate of the transistor that sits between PPBUS_G3H and the backlight circuit. The LED driver will short this pin to ground when backlight circuit is ready to turn on. Prerequisites are 1) it is told to turn on via enable signal, the screen has communicated with the LED driver 2) current sensing circuit is working 3) does not detect an over-current situation such as the backlight power rail being shorted to ground.
definitions.PP3V3_S0SW_LCD: What is PP3V3_S0SW_LCD? PP3V3_S0SW_LCD is a 3.3v power rail necessary to power the image circuitry on the screen. This is necessary to get a picture on the screen. .
definitions.PLT_RST_L: What is PLT_RST_L? This is an abbreviation of “PLT_RESET_L” – when you see “PLT_RST_L", assume the person meant to type PLT_RESET_L.
definitions.PM_SYSRST_L: What is PM_SYSRST_L? PM_SYSRST_L is a system reset signal present when it is low, _L means the signal asserts itself when the voltage is low. This signal needs to be high for the system to exit reset mode & turn on properly. .
definitions.PM_PCH_PWROK: What is PM_PCH_PWROK? PM_PCH_PWROK is usually created by U1950, a 74LVC2G08GT chip and is necessary for the machine to wake from an S5 and S4 state and turn on. This signal will be present if ALL_SYS_PWRGD, CPU_VR_PGOOD, PP3V3_S0, and PP3V42_G3H are present. When this signal is not present or intermittent, usually pin 8 on U1950 for PP3V42_G3H is corroded..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Backlight/Video
threads.message:
The Board is Pretty Much Clean.
No external video as well.

Here is some measurements:

With Screen:
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> = 0V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> = 0V
<SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> = 0V


Without the screen:
<SIGNAL>BUF_EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> = 0V
<SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> = 0V
<SIGNAL>BKLT_SD</SIGNAL> = 12.85V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0_BKLT_A</SIGNAL> = 5V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0_BKLT_A</SIGNAL> = 5V

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3.4

<SIGNAL>PPVCCSA_S0G</SIGNAL> = 0.7V
<SIGNAL>PP1V_S3</SIGNAL> = 0.93V

Diode Mode:
<SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> 1.200

[B]<CHIP>U8400</CHIP> Replaced
Tested with a different screen.[/B]


Any hint? 
Thank you

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Backlight/Video
threads.message: I would not search for video, before assuring USB activity...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Backlight/Video
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Backlight/Video
threads.message:
100% USB activity confirmed with OSX pendrive?
Link LED flashing assures that...

"<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> = 0V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> = 0V"
Check for pulse at least in first seconds when board turns on.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Backlight/Video
threads.message: I Tried with a flash drive (OSX) and doesn't work (no flashing).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Backlight/Video
threads.message:
Do you get <SIGNAL>PPVCCCPU_S0G</SIGNAL> voltage?
<SIGNAL>PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL> goes hjgh?

There should be some history fault.
No reason to search for image, if no USB activity confirmed...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Backlight/Video
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPVCCCPU_S0G</SIGNAL> = 0.7V and goes 1.5V after 10Sec and Comeback to 0.7V
<SIGNAL>PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL> = 0.65V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Backlight/Video
threads.message:
Board cannot work with platform reset enabled!

Check <SIGNAL>CPU_VCCST_PWRGD_R</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_SYSRST_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PM_PGOOD_CPUVCC</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Backlight/Video
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Backlight/Video
threads.message:
All look good.
Check also <SIGNAL>PM_PCH_PWROK</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PM_SYSRST_L</SIGNAL>.

Because VCORE looks like board boots...

Try known good working BIOS.

Bios Re-program and still not working.
I Got all the rails, but no external/internal video.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Backlight/Video
threads.message:
If you cannot confirm USB activity, do not expect video.
Can be CPU, ot RAM problem, if BIOS is good.
Or just a corroded resistor...
